intro: Kedrostis nana, commonly known as the dwarf African breadfruit, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. The plant produces small, green, spherical fruits that are typically harvested when immature and used as a vegetable. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can be used in traditional medicine. Kedrostis nana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
